text: Leucargyra puralis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1896. It is found in Brazil. The wingspan is about 60 mm. The forewings are silvery white. The larvae have been recorded feeding inside grasses.Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London 1895: 960 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1896 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Fauna of Brazil Category:Moths of South America
title: Leucargyra puralis
